content: 9 in yellow 6 in off-white 9 in yellow 7 in off-white round 7 the stitch pattern will be 5 single_crochet increase x 6 42 with the following color changes 5 single_crochet in off-white increase with one in off-white and one in yellow 5 single_crochet in yellow increase in yellow 3 single_crochet in yellow single_crochet in off-white but insert the hook into the lower v of the off-white stitch in the previous row single_crochet in off-white increase in off-white single_crochet in off-white single_crochet in off-white but insert the hook into the lower v of the off-white stitch in the previous row 3 single_crochet in yellow increase in yellow 5 single_crochet in yellow increase with one in yellow and one in off-white 5 single_crochet in off-white increase in off-white in the end you will have 42 stitches 7 in off-white 11 in yellow 6 in off-white 11 in yellow 7 in off-white for the next three row you could carry the off-white yarn all the way but this is a bit wasteful bulky and could have color show through i only carried under the off-white stitches by folding the yarn back on the work making sure it is slack enough i carry it over all the off-white and three yellow stitches this helps with gauge issues being too loose at the color change the loop of the previous round can be hidden under these few yellow stitches too image is when i was making charizard but the idea is the same this image shows what i mean by backwards carrying the yellow yarn rounds 8 4 single_crochet in off-white decrease in off-white increase in yellow 26 single_crochet in yellow increase in yellow decrease in off-white 6 in off-white in the end you will have 42 stitches with 12 off-white stitches and 30 yellow stitches pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin round 9 & 10 4 single_crochet in off-white single_crochet in off-white but insert the hook into the lower v of the off-white stitch in the previous row 30 yellow stitches single_crochet in off-white but insert the hook into the lower v of the off-white stitch in the previous row for round 9 the previous stitch was a decrease insert first tilted v 6 single_crochet in off-white 42 round 11 4 single_crochet in off-white single_crochet in off-white but insert the hook into the lower v of the off-white stitch in the previous row use a 4 00mm/g6 hook and 30 chain stitches in yellow and 1 change stitch in off-white return to using 3 25 mm/ usd3 hook attached to the next off-white stitch 31 stitches from where you started chain stitches technically this should be 30 chains but i find adding a chain makes the next row easier this stitch will also be made in the v of the previous row 6 single_crochet in off-white since you are making the opening you cannot catch the previous off-white yarn under a few yellow stitches it will just hide in
